meanings.definition: The act of seizing or holding fast with the teeth or jaws.
meanings.sent1: The dog's bighting of the bone showed its strength.
meanings.sent2: The lion's bighting of its prey was swift and powerful.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful bighting of the toy made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her bighting of the sandwich was so quick, it was gone in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The shark's bighting of the fish was a fearsome sight.

meanings.definition: A bend or loop in a rope.
meanings.sent1: The sailor secured the boat with a tight bighting of the rope.
meanings.sent2: The knot had a perfect bighting, ensuring the boat stayed in place.
meanings.sent3: The magician used the bighting of the rope in his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The bighting of the rope resembled a snake coiled around the pole.
meanings.sent5: The bighting of the rope was so strong, it held the entire weight of the sail.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting into or making a groove in something.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter's precise bighting of the wood created a perfect joint.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor's bighting of the clay gave shape to the masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The chef's bighting of the cake resulted in a unique design.
meanings.sent4: The knife's bighting of the fruit left a clean and neat slice.
meanings.sent5: The artist's bighting of the canvas added depth to the painting.
